transportAdvice: Toledo's historic old city is compact and best explored on foot, though its steep, cobbled streets can be tiring; a local bus service connects the old town with the train and bus stations, and taxis are readily available for longer distances or when arriving with luggage.

weather.description: Cold and occasionally wet with crisp air; warm layers are essential for sightseeing.
Still cool with some rainy spells, but days begin to lengthen noticeably.
Mild and variable with occasional showers; a good time to visit before summer crowds arrive.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming landscapes and comfortable temperatures for walking.
Warm and largely sunny; one of the most enjoyable months to explore the city.
Hot and dry with long sunny days; early morning sightseeing is advisable.
Very hot and dry; midday heat can be intense so plan outdoor activities for morning or evening.
Remains very hot with little rainfall; stay hydrated and seek shade during peak afternoon hours.
Temperatures ease pleasantly and crowds thin; a comfortable month for sightseeing.
Mild autumn weather with occasional rain; good conditions for exploring without summer heat.
Noticeably cooler with more frequent overcast skies and some rain.
Cold and quiet with a festive atmosphere; pack warm clothing for outdoor exploration.
